class  OppImpl

Detailed Description

Receives data pushed in by a remote OPP client and saves it to a to a DataSink instance.

This class offers a simplified asynchronous interface to applications who need to act as an OBEX OPP (Object Push Pull) server.

Users must subclass ObexOppDataSinkPushServer and implement at least the abstract methods OnPushIncoming() and OnPushComplete().

OnPushIncoming() is called to indicate when an object PUSH operation is initiated by a remote client. A server can then either accept the operation by calling Accept() and submitting an instance of an class derived from the DataSink interface class, or reject it by calling Cancel().

When Accept() is called the incoming operation becomes the currently ongoing operation and data will be automatically received chunk by chunk and written to the user-supplied DataSink object until either the whole object has been received or the maximum object size has been exceeded. When an object has been entirely received OnDataComplete() is invoked. This method may be overridden to intercept the operation just before the last response is sent towards the client. Calling Cancel() will cancel the operation, telling the remote client that the operation was rejected by the server, whereas calling Confirm() informs the client that the operation terminated successfully.

When a request was accepted by the server OnPushComplete() is called at the end of the operation and indicates either success (good ObexResult, evaluates to 'TRUE') or failure. When the operation was aborted by the remote client, the client's optional DESCRIPTION header is also available to the user.

After OnPushComplete() has been invoked, the ObexOppDataSinkPushServer instance is ready to handle the next incoming PUSH operation.

ObexOppDataSinkPushServer::ObexOppDataSinkPushServer (  MimeType  mime_type,
ExecutionContext *  ctx_ptr
) 
 

Constructor. Constructs a usable object instance.

Intended to be used with dynamically allocated objects (new).

Parameters:
ctx_ptr Execution context to be used by the server. All notification methods (protected: On.....()) will be called from this context. You may pass '0' as actual parameter to specify the currently active context, which must be valid at construction the time.
mime_type Mime type of the objects the server is interested in.

Reimplemented from ObexOppServer.

void ObexOppDataSinkPushServer::OnDataComplete (   )  [virtual]
 

Indicates that a complete OBEX object BODY has been received.

When this method is called all OBEX BODY data of the current PUSH operation has been received and written to the DataSink instance which was passed to Accept(). Now that the whole object is available to the server, it can be elaborated (for example, parsing a VCard) to prepare for the decision whether it should be either kept ( call Confirm() ) or discarded ( call Cancel() ).

This will cause the final response to be sent to the remote client, informing it on the server's decision and finish the operation.

The default implementation of this method calls Confirm(), so if you override the method please don't call the inherited method from your implementation !

virtual void ObexOppDataSinkPushServer::OnPushComplete (  ObexResult  result,
const WString &  description
)  [pure virtual]
 

Indicates completion of a PUSH operation.

Parameters:
result Evaluates to 'TRUE' when the operation was completed successfully, 'FALSE' otherwise.
description In case of a client ABORT this parameter optionally contains a verbal description of the error cause.

Reimplemented from ObexOppServer.

virtual void ObexOppDataSinkPushServer::OnPushIncoming (  const WString &  obj_name,
MimeType  obj_type,
const WString &  obj_desc,
UINT32  obj_size
)  [pure virtual]
 

Indicates an incoming push operation.

After evaluation of the parameters, either call Accept() to begin the data transfer or Cancel() to reject the operation. In the latter case, no operation is started and therefore neither OnDataComplete() nor OnPushComplete() are called.

Parameters:
obj_name Name of the object being pushed.
obj_type MimeType of the object being pushed. This is always one of the MimeTypes the server has registered for.
obj_desc Textual description of the object content.
obj_size Size of the whole object as read from the OBEX LENGTH header when present. If the size equals '0', it is not yet known.
